name: deprecation
content:
deprecation noun [U]
(DISAPPROVAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of not approving of something or saying that you do not approve of something: She couldn't hide the deprecation in her voice. The barman shook his head in deprecation. See
deprecate
More examplesFewer examplesHe held up his hand in scornful deprecation.She made a noise somewhere between deprecation and encouragement.He raised his eyes in deprecation of the surroundings.

deprecation noun [U]
(CRITICISM)
the action of saying that you think something is of little value or importance: He was generous with praise for the Philharmonic and with deprecation for himself. I resent your implicit deprecation of American skills. See
deprecate
More examplesFewer examples"I am a rural peasant," he added with habitual deprecation.There is no reason for national deprecation."I paint a bit for fun," she said, with a grimace of deprecation for the unsatisfactory results.
